Widespread in tropical and subtropical South America, including NE Argentina, Bolivia, Brazil, Paraguay, and Venezuela ( Anzoategui , Apure, Aragua, Delta Amacuro, Falcon , Guarico , Portuguesa, Sucre, Zulia). Records for Central America and the Caribbean need confirmation. Previously recorded from Venezuela (Apure) by Oliva (2002) .
The apex of the median lobe is a fine membranous dome, which may be considerably deformed in dry-mounted specimens. See discussion of Berosus megaphallus sp. n.
